attractions.name: National Arts Theatre
attractions.address: Tafawa Balewa Square, Lagos Island, Lagos State
attractions.description: A magnificent architectural landmark and cultural hub showcasing Nigeria's rich artistic heritage. The theatre hosts major performances, exhibitions, and cultural events.

attractions.name: Lagos Central Mosque
attractions.description: An iconic religious and architectural monument that stands as a symbol of Lagos' diverse religious heritage and beautiful Islamic architecture.

attractions.name: Lekki Conservation Centre
attractions.description: A nature reserve featuring Nigeria's longest canopy walkway, diverse wildlife, and pristine wetlands perfect for eco-tourism and environmental education.

attractions.name: Victoria Island Business District
attractions.description: The premier business and financial district of Nigeria, home to multinational corporations, luxury hotels, and modern commercial developments.

attractions.name: Nike Art Gallery
attractions.address: Nike Davies-Okundaye Street, Lekki Phase 1, Lagos State
attractions.description: Nigeria's largest art gallery showcasing contemporary and traditional African art, textiles, and crafts across multiple floors of exhibitions.

attractions.name: Tarkwa Bay Beach
attractions.description: A pristine island beach accessible only by boat, offering crystal clear waters, white sand, and a peaceful escape from the bustling city.

attractions.name: Freedom Park Lagos
attractions.address: Broad Street, Lagos Island, Lagos State
attractions.description: A historic cultural center and recreational park built on the site of the old colonial prison, now hosting concerts, festivals, and community events.

attractions.name: Eko Atlantic City
attractions.description: A modern planned city built on reclaimed land, featuring futuristic architecture, business centers, and representing the future of urban development in Africa.
